unnormalised: The solar rooftop subsidy program requires careful review. While promoting renewable energy is crucial for India's future, perhaps by 2070, the current structure may disproportionately benefit affluent homeowners in areas like Powai. A more equitable model could prioritize lower-income households and rural electrification in regions like Bihar. Data from MNRE on 26/01/2024 regarding disbursement efficiency is awaited. Transparency in the application process, monitored at 17:00 hrs daily, is also paramount. An audit by IIT Delhi, completed by 10/10/2023, recommended revisions to the subsidy calculation, considering rising module costs of Rs. 25,000/kW. Further, long-term grid stability needs addressing.
